description: Shows the entire Access Rules layer. This layer is divided into sections. An Access Rule may be within a section, or independent of a section (in which case it is said to be under the "global" section). The reply features a list of objects. Each object may be a section of the layer, with all its rules in, or a rule itself, for the case of rules which are under the global section. An optional "filter" field may be added in order to filter out only those rules that match a search criteria.

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Send JSON object to use the API Web Services

headers.name: X-chkp-sid
headers.description: Session unique identifier as it returned by the login request

body.name: name
body.description: Object name. Must be unique in the domain.

body.name: filter
body.description: Search expression to filter the rulebase. The provided text should be exactly the same as it would be given in Smart Console. The logical operators in the expression ('AND', 'OR') should be provided in capital letters. If an operator is not used, the default OR operator applies.

body.name: search-mode
body.description: When set to 'general', both the Full Text Search and Packet Search are enabled. In this mode, Packet Search will not match on 'Any' object, a negated cell or a group-with-exclusion. When the search-mode is set to 'packet', by default, the match on 'Any' object, a negated cell or a group-with-exclusion are enabled. packet-search-settings may be provided to change the default behavior.

body.name: expand-group-members
body.description: When true, if the search expression contains a UID or a name of a group object, results will include rules that match on at least one member of the group.

body.name: expand-group-with-exclusion-members
body.description: When true, if the search expression contains a UID or a name of a group-with-exclusion object, results will include rules that match at least one member of the "include" part and is not a member of the "except" part.

body.name: match-on-group-with-exclusion
body.description: Whether to match on a group-with-exclusion.

body.name: match-on-negate
body.description: Whether to match on a negated cell.

body.name: limit
body.description: The maximal number of returned results.

body.name: offset
body.description: Number of the results to initially skip.

body.name: ASC
body.description: Sorts results by the given field in ascending order.

body.name: show-as-ranges
body.description: When true, the source, destination and services & applications parameters are displayed as ranges of IP addresses and port numbers rather than network objects. Objects that are not represented using IP addresses or port numbers are presented as objects. In addition, the response of each rule does not contain the parameters: source, source-negate, destination, destination-negate, service and service-negate, but instead it contains the parameters: source-ranges, destination-ranges and service-ranges. Note: Requesting to show rules as ranges is limited up to 20 rules per request, otherwise an error is returned. If you wish to request more rules, use the offset and limit parameters to limit your request.

body.name: show-expiration-settings
body.description: Indicates whether to calculate and show "expiration date settings" field in reply.

success.name: name
success.description: Object name. Must be unique in the domain.

success.name: from
success.description: From which element number the query was done.

success.name: name
success.description: Object name. Must be unique in the domain.

success.name: color
success.description: Color of the object. Should be one of existing colors.

success.name: name
success.description: Object name. Must be unique in the domain.

success.name: to
success.description: To which element number the query was done.

success.name: total
success.description: Total number of elements returned by the query.

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

show-access-rulebase.description: Shows the entire Access Rules Rulebase.

show-access-rulebase with rules displaye.description: Shows the Access Rules with their members displayed as ranges, and not as Check Point Objects. This is limited to maximum 20 rules at a time.

show-access-rulebase-with-filter.description: Shows the entire Access Rules Rulebase.

show-access-rulebase with filter by rule.description: Shows an Access Control Rulebase filtered by a predefined list of rule UID's.Note: this filter is supported with API version 1.4 and above.
show-access-rulebase with filter by rule.request:
POST {{server}}/show-access-rulebase
Content-Type: application/json
X-chkp-sid: {{session}}

{
  "offset" : 0,
  "limit" : 20,
  "name" : "Network",
  "details-level" : "standard",
  "use-object-dictionary" : true,
  "filter" : "uid:be146170-a996-47c8-acfd-2b7dfb9e6d0f OR uid:f35e49c9-1032-41ab-babb-40ccc95b3df4 OR uid:8ed702b5-4f0f-4539-9e0e-264a22de9149"
}

show-access-rulebase-with-filter-expand-.description: For a given group, finds the Access Control Rules that match at least one member of the group. In this example, "HR-Managers-Server" object is a member of the "HR" group, and therefore rules which contain this object will not be matched.

show-access-rulebase with filter expand.description: For a given Group with Exclusion, shows the Access Control Rules that match at least one member of the "include" part and is not a member of the "except" part. In this example, the group-with-exclusion "HR except Managers" contains the "HR" group in "include" parameter and the "Managers" in the "except" parameter. HR-Managers-Server object is a member of both "HR" and "Managers", and therefore rules which contain this object will not be matched. HR-Employees-Server is a member of "HR" and not a member of "Managers" and therefore rules that contain this object will be matched.
